text: Hooey was a humour magazine published by Popular Magazines in the 1930s. The magazine presented spoof ads and articles much in the manner popularised by the 1950s magazine Mad. ==References== ==External links== * Henri Weiner: Cartoonist for Hooey magazine * Hooey magazine entry at Time magazine website Category:Satirical magazines published in the United States Category:Defunct magazines published in the United States Category:Humor magazines Category:Magazines with year of establishment missing Category:Magazines with year of disestablishment missing
title: Hooey
